data.title: KSL NewsRadio 102.7 FM: Utah News, Weather, Traffic & Opinion
data.meta_description: Utah news, weather, traffic, business, politics, entertainment, opinion, and talk radio for Salt Lake City and the Wasatch Front.
data.text:
Don Brinkerhoff

After recent drownings in Utah parks, official shares safety reminders

Several drownings in Utah have one Utah State Parks official sharing reminders about wearing a lifejacket and being mindful of weather.

Mariah Maynes

Two arrested in connection to Mt. Olympus trailhead shooting

Police have arrested two suspects in connection to an August 3 shooting at the Mount Olympus Trailhead.

Carter Williams, KSL.com

30% fee increase proposed for Lees Ferry campground near Lake Powell

Lees Ferry saw 5.2 million visits in 2023, and during the first months of 2024 visitation was up 16%.

Britt Johnson

How many Californians are really moving to Utah?

It seems like Utah has become a magnet for Californians looking to relocate, but is that really the case? New data shows otherwise.

Aimee Cobabe

Many Utah students returning to school with no air conditioning

Kids across the Wasatch Front are returning to school this week; in many schools, they're returning to no air conditioning.

Kyle Remund

Flash flood warning in Utah County, Salt Lake, and Heber

UTAH COUNTY ‚Äî A flash flood warning is in place for portions of the Utah, Salt Lake, and Heber Valley areas until 5:30 p.m. Monday, August 12. High water warnings have also been issued for portions of SR-201 and SR-202. üåß‚ö† Flood Advisories are currently out for portions of the Salt Lake Valley, northern Utah [‚Ä¶]

Alexandrea Bonilla

Meteorologist says incoming storms could come with microbursts

The National Weather Service of Salt Lake has issued weather warnings for much of the state. Thunderstorms and wind can cause fast moving microbursts.

Adam Small & Devin Oldroyd

Thunderstorms bring impressive rain, flash floods to Utah

Thunderstorms left behind an impressive amount of rain across Utah. The storms also caused some flash flooding.

Mark Jones

Southern and central Utah impacted by monsoonal moisture

Monsoonal moisture brought heavy showers and storms across central and southern Utah on Sunday, with the threat continuing into Monday.

Curt Gresseth, Diana Jones

Movie "It Ends With Us" shines harsh light on domestic violence

A therapist shares her experience about domestic violence from the point of view of both victim and abuser.

Michelle Lee

A recovering alcoholic shares his story

Randall Carlisle is the Media and Community Affairs Specialist at Odyssey House of Utah. He was a functional alcoholic for 40 years, and he is now in recovery.

Curt Gresseth

Can an experience instead of a purchase save the American shopping mall?

The shopping mall is dying, but could an experience instead of a purchase reverse its demise?

Michelle Lee

Is Disneyland no longer ‚Äùthe happiest place on earth?"

What was once a popular travel destination for a lot of people is now in their travel plans no longer. Where did things go wrong?

Jessica Lowell and Kira Hoffelmeyer

Lyman lawsuit calls for removal of Gov., LG, and demands he be put on ballot

Lyman won at the Republican Party Convention but lost in the primary to Gov. Spencer Cox. He's asking for Cox to be removed from office.

Michelle Lee

An inside scoop of the historic prisoner swap

In one of the largest prisoner swaps since the end of the Cold War, more than a dozen Americans were released and sent home to their families.

Curt Gresseth

Liberal arts education is a good choice for students, says professor

Education in the liberal arts is trending down in the US, but a University of Pennsylvania professor argues for pursuing liberal arts.

Devin Oldroyd

New law raises Washington DC childcare cost and affects childcare staff

A newly implemented city regulation in Washington DC is making the city and childcare even more expensive and unsustainable for families.

Curt Gresseth

Inflation eases but grocery store prices in Utah still stinging

Inflation eases slightly in April, but in Utah, consumers are still feeling the pinch of grocery-store prices.

Simone Seikaly

'Don't listen to the nos' UVU commencement speaker tells students

UVU grads were just as inspiring to speaker Jamie Kern Lima as she hoped to be for them, she said of her 2024 commencement speech.

Isabella Sandston

LISTEN: Why we‚Äôre turning to politics for our lost worship

Is a shift away from organized religion feeding into the loss of community amongst Americans?

Brian Preece

Salt Lake Bees Announce 2025 Season Schedule

Eight months before they'll play a game at Daybreak Field at America First Square, the Salt Lake Bees have announced their 2025 schedule.

Ben Anderson

Jazz Mailbag: How Can The Jazz Use Drew Eubanks?

Welcome to the Utah Jazz mailbag where this week we look at the different ways the team can use Drew Eubanks this season.

Steve Bartle

Utah Football Recruiting Round-Up

SALT LAKE CITY ‚Äì It‚Äôs been a pretty successful summer of recruiting for Kyle Whittingham‚Äôs Utah Football program. The Utes have secured 18 commitments in their 2025 recruiting class, with two coming last week. With the season just a couple of weeks away from kickoff, there are still top priorities Utah will try to close [‚Ä¶]

Brian Preece

60 In 60: #14 Utah‚Äôs Spencer Fano (Offensive Tackle)

The countdown is on for Hans and Scotty‚Äôs 60 in 60 for the 2024 college football season. Utah offensive tackle Spencer Fano lands at No. 14.

Brian Preece

How To Watch Game Night Live: Corner Canyon Chargers @ American Fork Cavemen

The Corner Canyon Chargers, the defending 6A state champion and preseason No. 1 team in the state, travel south to take on the No. 5 American Fork Cavemen on Friday, August 16.

KSL NewsRadio Video

Video: 'It Ends With Us' opens discussion on domestic violence

The release of‚ÄùIt Ends With Us‚Äù prompted new discussions about domestic violence. Dave & Dujanovic spoke to an expert to discuss the film‚Äôs themes. Domestic violence resources: Utah Domestic Violence Coalition: Utah‚Äôs confidential statewide, 24-hour domestic violence hotline at 1-800-897-LINK (5465) YWCA Women in Jeopardy program: 801-537-8600 Utah‚Äôs statewide child abuse and neglect hotline: 1-855-323-DCFS [‚Ä¶]

KSL NewsRadio Video

Video: SLC Winter Olympics venues then and now

As Utah once again looks to host the Winter Olympics, we take a look at some of the iconic Olympic venues as they were 20 years ago and as they are now.

Cowabunga Bay

Spend the last days of summer at Cowabunga Bay!

Cowabunga Bay is one of Utah's premier water parks that features water slides, a lazy river, a kids' cove, and a beach with lounge chairs.

Bear Lake Convention & Visitors Bureau

The best restaurants to try in Bear Lake

Save this guide to the best restaurants in Bear Lake when you need to find a place to dine during your next visit.
